forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Mostly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Light Rain then Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 10pm, then a chance of rain showers. Partly cloudy, with a low around 46. West northwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, this afternoon unfolds with a gentle caress of sunshine, though the horizon teeters on the edge of a possible rain shower. The temperature hovers in the mid-fifties, a subtle reminder of the season's cool embrace as west winds whisper at 15 mph, occasionally gusting stronger. Wisps of cloud drift lazily across the sky, casting a delicate veil over the city’s iconic skyline, enriching the air with a promise of change. The chance of precipitation flirts at 20%, offering only the slightest hope for a cleansing rain.

As twilight descends, expect a shift; a slight chance of rain emerges before 10 p.m., ramping up to a 40% likelihood of scattered showers throughout the night. The temperature will dip towards the mid-forties, inviting you to wrap yourself in a cozy layer. A light or medium jacket would serve well against the cool, breezy spells that will persist through the evening. In these conditions, consider a leisurely walk along the Embarcadero or a quiet evening with a good book in your favorite café, perfect for watching the city’s vibrant life play out as the air freshens with the scent of impending rain.
